text: Richard Axel (born July 2, 1946 in Brooklyn, New York City) is an American neuroscientist. He won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 2004 for working on the olfactory receptors which he shared with Linda B. Buck. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:Living people Category:American biologists Category:Jewish Nobel Prize winners Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:Columbia University alumni Category:Scientists from Brooklyn
title: Richard Axel
